doc.abstracts: The political and security transition has affected Afghanistan’s economy much more deeply than anticipated. Economic growth slowed significantly in 2014-2015 as a result of continued political uncertainty and an increase in violence. Fiscal vulnerabilities remain high and will require a large revenue effort and sustained levels of aid. The medium-term outlook projects a sluggish growth recovery. Future prospects hinge critically on improvements in security and forceful implementation of reforms.
